titleStmt.title: Samuel Coulter v. W.C. Hawks. Attachment

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Samuel Coulter v. W.C. Hawks. Attachment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington Second Judicial District
In the name of the United States of America

To W.C. Hawks: We command you that you have the body of Samuel Coulter by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name the said Samuel Coulter shall be called or charged, before Hon Roger S. Greene one of the Associate Justices of the Supreme Court of Washington Territory and District Judge of the Second Judicial District immediately after the receipt of this writ, to do and to receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Samuel Coulter and Associate Justice of the Supreme Court at Washington Territory and Judge of the Second Judicial District this 24th day of January A.D. 1872
This Writ allowed by me this 24th day of January 1872 R.S. Greene Judge
Territory Washington County of Thurston } ss

W.C Hawks being duly sworn says that the authority by which he detains the impri- soned Samuel Coulter is that of a writ or order of Hon O. Jacobs Judge of the said Court of the 3rd Judicial Dist of W.T. holding terms at Steilacoom by the clerk of said Court and the seal of said court. A copy of which is hereto attached. And affiant also produces the said Samuel Coulter before the Hon R.S. Greene Judge of the Court named in this Writ or therein commanded.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 24th Jany A.D. 1872
J.H. Houghton Clk Dist Ct 2nd Jud Dist
